answers.answer: Hi there.This is really an unusual situation.  From what you have described, you may have had an immune phenomenon related to the vaccination you received.  There could have been antibodies produced towards your own cells or tissues (may be towards the nerves or muscles) that eventually caused your symptoms of some sort of paralysis.Another uncommon condition is tetanus.  This would lead to stiff muscles and hyperexcitability leading to stiffness and seizure like symptoms.For the autoimmune phenomenon, treatment with IVIg may help diminish the symptoms, and I suggest you discuss this angle with your doctor.Regards.

question: In Nov. 2007 I received the flu vaccine and exactly 1 week later I became ill w/ flu like symptoms.Three days later I could not move and my chest hurt. Turned out, I had pneumonia. My legs did give out but I was told this was normal. this was on FRI by the next morning I could only stare. I was tested for a stroke and  was told by neuroligist it was not. I still cannot walk or do things with my hands. I have had multiple MRI's and cat scans all negative.i am 37 yo, had diabetes since I was 5. I have had no changes in 6 months. i am curious if you have heard of this.
